intro: Nemophila heterophylla var. euheterophylla, commonly known as the variable blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas. It has variable leaf shapes, which give it its scientific name, and it blooms from spring to early summer. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
